intro: Zollernia ulei, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to two meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing a striking display that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Zollernia ulei is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in full sun.
